CORPORATE ACCOUNTANT

SUMMARY

Over 15 years of increasingly responsible experience in general accounting, budgeting and reporting, fixed asset management, project management, payroll and income tax preparation, and database administration.
Eager to acquire a position in a prestigious organization, where I actively participate in their enhancement and my education, professional experience, and skills become a positive feature to the company.
Capable Accountant successful at managing multiple projects and consistently meeting deadlines under pressure.
Extensive knowledge of accounting software and processes.

*SPC4 -B Co. 192nd Support Battalion (76P10) - Logistics experience 1989-1992 *Acquaintance on SAGE, BANNER Financial, Infoview, SAP R3, SAP Business 1, FAS 500, QuickBooks, Labor Trak, Ceridian, Paychex and ADP payroll systems, MAPICS (SyteLine-manufacturing), Vertex (taxes), Outlook, Word, Excel, Power Point, Lync and Pro-series software.
Analytical reasoning Account reconciliation expert Budget forecasting expertise General ledger accounting *ISO9001 QMM Auditor, Crosby Certify and knowledge of the full spectrum leadership imperatives skills

<JD_START>
Job Title: Senior Accountant (Corp174)

Location: Alexandria, VA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
Research Innovations, Inc. (RII) is breaking through the big, slow, status quo with transformative technology that fundamentally changes and improves the world. We develop cutting-edge software for all levels of the government and military. We use agile development practices and user-centered design to create innovative software solutions for complex real-world problems.

RII is looking for a committed Senior Accountant to join our growing Finance & Accounting team. The Senior Accountant will support the General Ledger team in its monthly activities focused on month-end close and financial reporting. The candidate will be working with the project finance and FP&A teams and will be responsible for booking various monthly journal entries, monitor accounts payables, billings, payroll, balance sheet reconciliations, and conduct monthly financial analysis and reporting. The ideal candidate will be eager to learn and grow in a fast-paced environment. They will be motivated to optimize every process they touch and partner with stakeholders up and down stream on continuous improvements.

This position requires the ability to obtain a US Secret Security Clearance. A current active clearance is not required.

What You Will Be Doing

Ensure payroll is compliant and accurate and provides excellent support to our managers and employees. This position will track any special dedications or garnishments, coordinate with finance and tax departments to ensure all tax filings and reporting is completed in a timely manner and work closely with other areas, such as, HRIS, Benefits and Compensation to ensure accuracy of employee data in the payroll systemPayroll related duties – timesheet/expense review, reconciliation, assisting employees with timesheetStrong skills using and understanding the flow of transactions in an integrated and automated payroll systemParticipate in the design, testing, and implementation of the payroll portion of the Paylocity HRIS systemPerform General Ledger responsibilities which include preparing Journal entries and related supporting documentation in accordance with best accounting practices and RII policies and proceduresReconcile semi-monthly labor and payroll calculation in coordination with Human Resources, and Professional Employment OrganizationCoordinate accounts payable activities by ensuring proper charge codes and timely AP payments, in coordination with program controllers, and resolving vendor inquiriesReview expense reports and Purchase Card activities for timely submissions and proper coding; assisting employees across the company with charge code issues and approvalsComplete monthly balance sheet reconciliations and resolve reconciling items on a timely basis and in accordance with company policies and proceduresResponsible for monthly billing cycle for all contract types including submission to client portals and facilitating communication with finance team Support various financial and tax audits or reviews by preparing deliverables and responding to inquiries and resolving issuesAssist with the development, documentation, implementation, and update of key processes and procedures to ensure compliance with the Company policies and proceduresAssist the Accounting Manager with various projects as assigned and complete various analysis and ad hoc supportAs a Senior Accountant, you will participate in accounting projects and related matters with the Accounting Manager, Program Controllers and Financial Planning and Analysis teamAssist with technical accounting research around equity, leases, and revenue recognition activities

What You Have Done

Bachelor's Degree in Business/Finance related field5+ years of experience in accounting or public accounting/auditingExperience with prevalent industry tools including Unanet is requiredPrevious payroll experienceExperience in the government contracting industry including cost accounting practicesExperience with various contract types (Fixed Price, Cost Plus, and T&M) preferredDetail oriented and strong documentation skillsAbility to handle multiple tasksStrong Excel skillsStrong analytical skillsExcellent interpersonal communication skillsAbility to work in an ambiguous environment with multiple initiatives and changing prioritiesStrong working knowledge of US GAAP requirements

At RII, we believe that diversity in our workforce is critical to our success. We strive to hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it’s the right thing to do, but because it makes us stronger. We work to help your intellectual passions and creativity thrive. It’s one of our core values: Let your geek flag fly.

We also offer all employees comprehensive benefits including: flexible work schedules, health insurance coverage, paid time off, 401k with a company match, paid parental leave, access to wellness programs and much more. You get this all from day one, and all paid for by RII.

It’s all part of another of our core values: Stay human. It’s why our comfortable and colorful offices such as our headquarters, include a community game room, pantry, massage chair, and an escape room, among other amenities. It’s why we have community managers and regular community events.

It’s also why, during the current pandemic, most of us aren’t actually in our lovely office. We’re all working fully remote where possible, with safety controls for those who do have to be on site. RII is committed to not overwhelming our healthcare system, preventing infection for those most at risk, reducing the impact on our communities, and keeping our employees working.

Research Innovations, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, national origin, genetics, disability status, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by state, federal or local law.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
